titlestmt.titleproper: Ford Foundation records, Office Files of Alison R. Bernstein
A Guide to the Ford Foundation records, Office Files of Alison R. Bernstein FA573

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-03-13 14:58:29 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Ford Foundation records, Office Files of Alison R. Bernstein

physdesc.extent: 79 letter document containers, 2 half letter document containers, 1 legal document container

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection documents the various roles Alison Bernstein held at the Ford Foundation between 1983 and 2010, including program officer, director of the Education and Culture program, and Vice President of the Education, Creativity and Free Expression Program, later called Creativity and Free Expression.

The collection includes Education, Media, Arts and Culture grant documents, chronological correspondence files, materials related to the Ford Foundation's African Higher Education Initiative, women's programs, international fellowships program files, Difficult Dialogues program correspondence and papers, Ford Foundation publications and reports, Ford Foundation program leadership material, files related to Ford Foundation Education and Culture programs abroad, articles by and about Bernstein, keynote speeches, field office chronological files, Board of Trustees meeting materials, program officer memos, staff retreat documents, and meeting and trip files, including briefing books, correspondence, and agendas from Ford visits to China, Egypt, France, Ghana, Russia, South Africa, and Vietnam.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Dr. Alison Bernstein worked at the Ford Foundation from 1983 until 2010, with a break in the early 1990s to assume the position of Associate Dean of the Faculty at Princeton University. Bernstein started as a program officer in 1983, and she was named director of Education and Culture at the Foundation in 1992. In 1996, Bernstein was later promoted to vice president of the Ford Foundation's Education, Creativity and Free Expression Program, later called called Creativity and Free Expression. In 2011, Bernstein left the Foundation to become the director of the Institute for Women's Leadership at Rutgers University.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Ford Foundation has title, copyright and literary rights in the collection, in so far as it holds them.

The Rockefeller Archive Center has authority to grant permission to cite and publish material from the collection. Permission to publish extensive excerpts, or material in its entirety, will be referred to the Ford Foundation.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: In an effort to consolidate Alison Bernstein's Ford Foundation files, several collections and accessions have been processed together. The files in Series 1: Program Officer Files, 1987-1990 and Series 2: Director Files, 1991-1993 were originally part of FA1352 Ford Foundation records, Education and Culture Program, Office Files of Alison Bernstein, 1987-1993. (These were ingested by RAC as Accessions 2017:077, 2017:090, 2018:037). The files in Series 3: Vice President Files, 1974-2007 was originally processed as FA573 Ford Foundation records, Knowledge, Creativity, and Freedom, Office of the Vice President, Office Files of Alison R. Bernstein, 1974-2010. (These files were ingested by RAC as Accession 2012:034). The material added in 2023 became Series 4: Executive Officer Subject Files, 1975-2010 (ingested by RAC as Accession 2021:085). The original order of the files and file titles were maintained as the material was combined into one collection.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The material in this collection was transferred from the Ford Foundation in 2012, 2017, 2018, and 2021 and ingested by RAC as Accessions 2012:034, 2017:077, 2017:090, 2018:037, and 2021:085.
